spec.name: Sidi Abderrahman Mausoleum
spec.description: The Sidi Abderrahman Mausoleum (Marabout de Sidi Abderrahman) is one of Casablanca's most recognizable religious and cultural sites. It is built on a **rocky islet** just off the Corniche, accessible by foot during low tide via a narrow causeway. The shrine honors a local saint, Sidi Abderrahman, attracting pilgrims who seek blessings and spiritual healing. Its unique location makes it both a religious site and a picturesque landmark.

people.comment: Revered local saint and spiritual figure.

timeline.title: Establishment Period
timeline.description: The shrine was established on the islet (Approximate historical period).

access.comment: Access to the islet is dependent on low tide; non-Muslims may be restricted from entering the shrine itself.
